author: David Marcelis
title: Americans Can Finally Buy Kinder Eggsâ€”Just Not the Ones They Want
text:
In recent weeks, a frenzy of social-media buzz whipped Ashley Andersen into a state of jubilation. A chocolate egg containing a toy, long outlawed in the U.S., had finally been decriminalized. 
The 27-year-old Oklahoma City native grew up enjoying the treat, known as Kinder Surprise, during trips to Denmark to visit family. U.S. authorities had long ago banned the hollow chocolate egg, because of an 80-year-old act forbidding food from containing nonedible items. 
...
